channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump says the U.S. has seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela
item.description: Using U.S. forces to take control of a merchant ship is unusual and marks the Trump administration's latest push to increase pressure on Maduro, who has been charged with narcoterrorism.
item.content:encoded:
Using U.S. forces to take control of a merchant ship is unusual and marks the Trump administration's latest push to increase pressure on Maduro, who has been charged with narcoterrorism.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: High school students learn trade skills building affordable housing in Colorado
item.description: Affordable housing and a shortage of skilled trades workers are both pressing issues in the U.S. A Colorado city is partnering with a local school district and Habitat for Humanity to teach kids trades by building homes working people can afford.
item.content:encoded:
Affordable housing and a shortage of skilled trades workers are both pressing issues in the U.S. A Colorado city is partnering with a local school district and Habitat for Humanity to teach kids trades by building homes working people can afford.

(Image credit: Sam Fuqua)
item.dc:creator: Sam Fuqua

item.title: NTSB warns that defense bill could undermine aviation safety changes after DCA crash
item.description: The head of the NTSB is voicing strong opposition to provisions in the defense policy bill. The NTSB says the House bill would undermine safety improvements made after the mid-air collision near DCA.
item.content:encoded:
The head of the NTSB is voicing strong opposition to provisions in the defense policy bill. The NTSB says the House bill would undermine safety improvements made after the mid-air collision near DCA.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Congress calls for a crackdown on companies charging disabled vets
item.description: Congress is calling for action in response to reporting last week from NPR that "claim shark" companies are using aggressive tactics to make millions off of veterans, despite warnings from VA's that it may be illegal.
item.content:encoded:
Congress is calling for action in response to reporting last week from NPR that "claim shark" companies are using aggressive tactics to make millions off of veterans, despite warnings from VA's that it may be illegal.

(Image credit: Kristina Barker for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: Afghan 'Zero Unit' fighters in the U.S. faced despair before National Guard attack
item.description: Many Afghan "Zero Unit" fighters who served under the CIA now feel they are being abandoned after seeking asylum in the U.S. They've faced despair and isolation - and some have taken their own lives.
item.content:encoded: Many Afghan "Zero Unit" fighters who served under the CIA now feel they are being abandoned after seeking asylum in the U.S. They've faced despair and isolation - and some have taken their own lives.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: An annual race in frigid temperatures helps revitalize a small Maine town
item.description: Every December, thousands of runners gather in a small northern Maine town to run a marathon through the frigid woods. The race started as an unlikely way to stoke the town's economy.
item.content:encoded: Every December, thousands of runners gather in a small northern Maine town to run a marathon through the frigid woods. The race started as an unlikely way to stoke the town's economy.
item.dc:creator: Grace Benninghoff

item.title: Egypt and Iran object to playing in a Seattle 'Pride' match in next year's World Cup
item.description: Local organizers had planned to include the June 26 game with Seattle's Pride celebrations. Then, FIFA announced the match would include Egypt and Iran, two countries where gay rights are nil.
item.content:encoded:
Local organizers had planned to include the June 26 game with Seattle's Pride celebrations. Then, FIFA announced the match would include Egypt and Iran, two countries where gay rights are nil.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Judge blocks Trump's National Guard deployment in LA with sharp rebuke
item.description: In the latest in a series of legal setbacks for Trump's deployments, a judge ruled the administration must end its deployment to Los Angeles and return control of National Guard troops to California.
item.content:encoded:
In the latest in a series of legal setbacks for Trump's deployments, a judge ruled the administration must end its deployment to Los Angeles and return control of National Guard troops to California.

(Image credit: Jim Vondruska)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: What to know about death cap mushrooms, blamed for poisonings in California
item.description: Death cap mushrooms look harmless, but are responsible for the majority of the world's mushroom-related deaths. California officials say 21 people have been sickened in recent weeks, one fatally.
item.content:encoded:
Death cap mushrooms look harmless, but are responsible for the majority of the world's mushroom-related deaths. California officials say 21 people have been sickened in recent weeks, one fatally.

(Image credit: William West)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Education Department recalls fired attorneys amid civil rights complaint backlog
item.description: The department said recalling these fired staffers would "bolster and refocus" civil rights enforcement "in a way that serves and benefits parents, students, and families."
item.content:encoded:
The department said recalling these fired staffers would "bolster and refocus" civil rights enforcement "in a way that serves and benefits parents, students, and families."

(Image credit: Bill Clark)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner
